planets.title: Planets
planets.description: Learn about the 8 planets in our solar system

mercury.facts: Closest to the Sun. Has the most extreme temperature differences (-173¬∞C to 427¬∞C). No atmosphere or moons.

venus.facts: Hottest planet (462¬∞C). Rotates backwards compared to other planets. Thick atmosphere of carbon dioxide.

earth.facts: The only planet with life! 71% water. Has 1 moon. Perfect distance from the Sun for liquid water.

mars.facts: The Red Planet. Has 2 small moons. Has the largest volcano in the solar system (Olympus Mons).

jupiter.facts: Gas giant with 79+ moons. Has the Great Red Spot (a giant storm). Could fit 1,300 Earths inside!

saturn.facts: Famous for its beautiful rings made of ice and rock. Has 82+ moons. Could float in water!

uranus.facts: Rotates on its side. Coldest planet (-224¬∞C). Has faint rings and 27 moons.

neptune.facts: Farthest from the Sun. Strongest winds in the solar system (2,100 km/h). Beautiful blue color.

stars.title: Stars & Galaxies
stars.description: Discover different types of stars and stellar objects

sun.name: Sun (Yellow Dwarf)
sun.description: Our Sun is a medium-sized star called a yellow dwarf. It's about 4.6 billion years old and will last another 5 billion years.
sun.characteristics: Temperature: 5,500¬∞C ‚Ä¢ Contains 99.86% of solar system's mass ‚Ä¢ Produces energy through nuclear fusion

red_giant.name: Red Giant
red_giant.description: A large, cool star in its late stage of life. Our Sun will become a red giant in about 5 billion years.
red_giant.characteristics: Very large size ‚Ä¢ Cooler surface (3,000¬∞C) ‚Ä¢ Red/orange color ‚Ä¢ Eventually becomes white dwarf

white_dwarf.name: White Dwarf
white_dwarf.description: The remnant core of a dead star. Very dense - a teaspoon would weigh several tons!
white_dwarf.characteristics: Very small but dense ‚Ä¢ Very hot surface ‚Ä¢ No nuclear fusion ‚Ä¢ Slowly cools over billions of years

neutron_star.name: Neutron Star
neutron_star.description: Created when a massive star explodes. Extremely dense - a sugar cube would weigh as much as all humanity!
neutron_star.characteristics: Extremely dense ‚Ä¢ Rotates very fast ‚Ä¢ Strong magnetic field ‚Ä¢ Only 20 km across

black_hole.name: Black Hole
black_hole.description: The most mysterious object in space! Gravity so strong that not even light can escape.
black_hole.characteristics: Infinite density at center ‚Ä¢ Warps space and time ‚Ä¢ Has event horizon ‚Ä¢ Can't be seen directly

stars.tip: Stars are born in nebulae (clouds of gas and dust) and can live for billions of years!

moon_phases.title: Moon Phases
moon_phases.description: Understand the phases of the Moon

new_moon.name: New Moon
new_moon.description: The Moon is between Earth and Sun. We can't see it because the dark side faces us.

waxing_crescent.name: Waxing Crescent
waxing_crescent.description: A thin crescent of the Moon becomes visible. It's getting bigger (waxing).

first_quarter.name: First Quarter
first_quarter.description: Half of the Moon is visible. It's called 'quarter' because the Moon is 1/4 way through its cycle.

waxing_gibbous.name: Waxing Gibbous
waxing_gibbous.description: More than half is visible. Getting closer to full moon.

full_moon.name: Full Moon
full_moon.description: The entire face of the Moon is illuminated. Earth is between the Sun and Moon.

waning_gibbous.name: Waning Gibbous
waning_gibbous.description: More than half is visible but getting smaller (waning).

last_quarter.name: Last Quarter
last_quarter.description: Half of the Moon is visible. The opposite half from first quarter.

waning_crescent.name: Waning Crescent
waning_crescent.description: A thin crescent is visible. Almost back to new moon.

moon_phases.tip: The Moon doesn't produce its own light! It reflects light from the Sun. The phases happen because we see different amounts of the sunlit side.
